description: Yehuda Halevi was a Sephardic Jewish poet, physician and philosopher. HaLevi is considered one of the greatest Hebrew-language poets and is celebrated for his secular and religious poems, many of which appear in present-day Jewish liturgy. His philosophical masterpiece, 'The Kuzari', details his defense of Judaism and his deep yearning for the Land of Israel.

poems.title: My Heart is in the East
